column5: Send me an email and we can chat offline about it. You can reach me at [email protected] All the best, Greg Bolinski Agate Bay Lodgewww.agatebaylodge.com NPAA #944

Unless we start seeing an increase in precipitation, it will likely be tough. Late last fall I had 15 more ft of beach than I normally do. It was the same on the smaller bush lakes also. Greg Bolinski Agate Bay Lodgewww.agatebaylodge.com NPAA #944

If you plan to fly into one of these lakes I can help with personal marked maps and travel info. Lakes---Makoki, Meta, Kap, Kayedon, and Melchett. E-mail [email protected] or call 330-866-3363 days for Dave in sales.:fishhit:
Dave, How is Makoki for walleye?

We fished Makoki a few years ago. Caught walleye off island points and in mouth of incoming streams. Size varied but most in the 1.5 to 3 pound range. Lake is small. Great size for 4 or less fisherman. Caught pike over 17 pounds in reeds and weeds. Can furnish map if you want. Have you fished the Nakina area before? If so who did you go in with? We have used AWO 10 times (outfitteer on Makoki, with number 11 coming this June. Anything else, just ask.:smash:
Used to fish the Nakina area when Don and Millie still had their camps (Nakina Air). My son fished Melchett a few years ago. I just enjoy the Nakina area.
Used to fish the Nakina area when Don and Millie still had their camps (Nakina Air). My son fished Melchett a few years ago. I just enjoy the Nakina area.
If I can give additional info, just ask.
If I can give additional info, just ask.
That entire area North of Superior is a great area. I am about 25 miles east of Longlac, and just love it up there! Greg Bolinski Agate Bay Lodgewww.agatebaylodge.com NPAA #944

Greg, I used to fish your area quite a bit from Lukinto Lake Lodge back when Bob & Faye owned it. I really enjoyed some of the bush lakes that we fished and would like to fish some of them again. I checked your website to see what lakes you fish but don't see a list, can you e-mail me one? I assume you have boats at the various lakes and take out motors and equipment daily?
How bad do you think the water levels will be this year?
